name: Sodium sulfite
desc: Sodium sulfite (sodium sulphite) is a soluble sodium salt of sulfurous acid (sulfite) with the chemical formula Na2SO3. It is a product of sulfur dioxide scrubbing, a part of the flue-gas desulfurization process. It is also used as a preservative to prevent dried fruit from discoloring, and for preserving meats, and is used in the same way as sodium thiosulfate to convert elemental halogens to their respective hydrohalic acids, in photography and for reducing chlorine levels in pools.
Solubility:
soluble in glycerol
insoluble in ammonia, chlorine
Related compounds:
Sodium bisulfite
Sodium metabisulfite
Sodium sulfate
